physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General physical examination showed no abnormality except for stigmata of TS: facial angiofibromas, ash leaf spots, shagreen patches, periungual fibromas, and retinal hamartomas. Ophthalmological evaluation showed papilledema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: MR imaging revealed worsening ventriculomegaly and increase in size of the right foramen of Monro SEGA.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination of fluid obtained from a lumbar puncture revealed similar-appearing cells in the patient’s CSF.
Patient was brought to the hospital in an obtunded condition.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan revealed hydrocephalus and patient was in a state of cardiac arrest.
